intro: Fagonia kahirina var. longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed fagonia, is a shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of North Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is adapted to harsh environments, with deep roots that help it survive in dry conditions. Its leaves are typically small and succulent, reducing water loss through transpiration. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
